item.title: Challenges Using Istio
item.author: dave@bennettnotes.com (Dave Bennett)
item.description: The team and I were searching for solutions that enabled us to secure the communication between the microservices that we have running in our Rancher cluster. Our first application consisted of a set of services that essentially performed CRUD operations using the typical RESTful architecture (GET, POST, PUT, etc). We decided to use Istio because it offered a compelling solution that incorporated the use of mTLS (mutual TLS authentication). For us, this meant that we didn’t need to manage certificates ourselves our worry about the individual TLS implementation of each service in its respective language.
